message: puppeteer: Up and running with a persistent connection!
filesystem: Up and running with a persistent connection!
excel: Up and running with a persistent connection!

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.

tools.name: excel_copy_sheet
tools.description: Copy existing sheet to a new sheet

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

srcSheetName.description: Source sheet name in the Excel file

tools.name: excel_create_table
tools.description: Create a table in the Excel sheet

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

sheetName.description: Sheet name where the table is created

tools.name: excel_describe_sheets
tools.description: List all sheet information of specified Excel file

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

tools.name: excel_read_sheet
tools.description: Read values from Excel sheet with pagination.

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

knownPagingRanges.description: List of already read paging ranges

range.description: Range of cells to read in the Excel sheet (e.g., "A1:C10"). [default: first paging range]

sheetName.description: Sheet name in the Excel file

tools.name: excel_screen_capture
tools.description: [Windows only] Take a screenshot of the Excel sheet with pagination.

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

knownPagingRanges.description: List of already read paging ranges

range.description: Range of cells to read in the Excel sheet (e.g., "A1:C10"). [default: first paging range]

sheetName.description: Sheet name in the Excel file

tools.name: excel_write_to_sheet
tools.description: Write values to the Excel sheet

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

newSheet.description: Create a new sheet if true, otherwise write to the existing sheet

range.description: Range of cells in the Excel sheet (e.g., "A1:C10")

sheetName.description: Sheet name in the Excel file

values.description: Values to write to the Excel sheet. If the value is a formula, it should start with "="

tools.name: puppeteer_navigate
tools.description: Navigate to a URL

launchOptions.description: PuppeteerJS LaunchOptions. Default null. If changed and not null, browser restarts. Example: { headless: true, args: ['--no-sandbox'] }

allowDangerous.description: Allow dangerous LaunchOptions that reduce security. When false, dangerous args like --no-sandbox will throw errors. Default false.

tools.name: puppeteer_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the current page or a specific element

selector.description: CSS selector for element to screenshot

encoded.description: If true, capture the screenshot as a base64-encoded data URI (as text) instead of binary image content. Default false.

tools.name: puppeteer_click
tools.description: Click an element on the page

selector.description: CSS selector for element to click

tools.name: puppeteer_fill
tools.description: Fill out an input field

selector.description: CSS selector for input field

tools.name: puppeteer_select
tools.description: Select an element on the page with Select tag

selector.description: CSS selector for element to select

tools.name: puppeteer_hover
tools.description: Hover an element on the page

selector.description: CSS selector for element to hover

tools.name: puppeteer_evaluate
tools.description: Execute JavaScript in the browser console

tools.name: __human_input__
tools.description:
Request input from a human user. Pauses the workflow until input is received.

Args:
    request: The human input request

Returns:
    The input provided by the human

Raises:
    TimeoutError: If the timeout is exceeded

request.description: Represents a request for human input.

Read Sheet

ABCDEF
1Test Case IDTest Case NameTest StepsExpected ResultsTest PriorityTest Type
2PLP-001Verify product display on Product Listing Page1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Verify that products are displayed on the Product Listing PageProducts are displayed with their images, names, and prices in a grid or list formatHighFunctional
3PLP-002Verify product information on hover/click1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Hover over/click on a product 3. Verify that product details are displayedProduct details (name, price, description) are displayed on hover/clickHighFunctional
4PLP-003Verify sorting functionality1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Click on sorting options (Name A-Z, Price Low to High) 3. Verify products are sorted accordinglyProducts are sorted based on the selected option correctlyMediumFunctional
5PLP-004Verify filtering functionality1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Apply filters (by category, price range) 3. Verify products are filtered accordinglyProducts are filtered based on the selected criteria correctlyMediumFunctional
6PLP-005Verify pagination functionality1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Click on pagination buttons (Next, Previous) 3. Verify products display correctly on each pageProducts are displayed correctly on each page, pagination buttons work correctlyMediumFunctional
7PLP-006Verify responsive design on different devices1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com on desktop, tablet, mobile 2. Verify Product Listing Page displays correctly on each devicePage is displayed correctly on each device with adapted layoutHighUI
8PLP-007Verify error handling for invalid filters1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Apply invalid filters (invalid price range) 3. Verify error message is displayedClear and descriptive error message is displayed for invalid filtersMediumFunctional
9PLP-008Verify navigation to product details page1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Click on a product 3. Verify product details page is displayedProduct details page is displayed with correct product detailsHighFunctional
10PLP-009Verify accessibility features1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Verify accessibility features (alt text, clear navigation)Product Listing Page is accessible with proper accessibility featuresMediumAccessibility
11PLP-010Verify Product Listing Page with no products1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Simulate scenario with no products 3. Verify appropriate message is displayedClear message indicating no products are available is displayedLowEdge Case
12PLP-011Verify Product Listing Page with multiple products1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Simulate scenario with large number of products 3. Verify page handles multiple products correctlyPage handles large number of products correctly without performance impactLowEdge Case
13PLP-012Verify product image loading1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Verify product images are loaded correctlyProduct images are loaded correctly in the correct formatMediumUI
14PLP-013Verify product name and price alignment1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Verify product names and prices are aligned correctlyProduct names and prices are aligned correctly with consistent layoutMediumUI
15PLP-014Verify product comparison functionality1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Select multiple products for comparison 3. Verify products are compared correctlyProducts are compared correctly with useful comparison featuresLowUsability
16PLP-015Verify page load time1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com 2. Measure the page load timePage load time is within acceptable limits with optimal performanceHighPerformance
17PLP-016Cart Icon and CounterFunctional1. Verify cart icon is visible
2. Add multiple products to cart
3. Check cart counter updates correctly		Cart icon displays correct count of itemsMedium
18PLP-017Page PerformancePerformance1. Measure page load time
2. Check image loading speed
3. Verify smooth scrolling		Page loads within acceptable time limitsMedium
19PLP-018Mobile ResponsivenessUI1. Access page on mobile device
2. Verify layout adapts properly
3. Test touch interactions		Page displays correctly on mobile devicesHigh
20PLP-019Cross-browser CompatibilityCompatibility1. Test on Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge
2. Verify consistent functionality
3. Check UI consistency		Page works consistently across different browsersMedium
21PLP-020Product Card Layout VerificationUI1. Navigate to the product listing page
2. Verify each product card contains:
- Product image
- Product name
- Product description
- Price with currency symbol
- Add to Cart button
3. Check alignment and spacing		All product cards display consistent layout with all required elements properly alignedHigh
22PLP-021Sorting by Name (A-Z)Functional1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Click on sort dropdown
3. Select 'Name (A to Z)' option
4. Verify products are sorted alphabetically ascending
5. Check first and last products match expected order		Products are sorted alphabetically from A to Z correctlyMedium
23PLP-022Sorting by Name (Z-A)Functional1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Click on sort dropdown
3. Select 'Name (Z to A)' option
4. Verify products are sorted alphabetically descending
5. Check first and last products match expected order		Products are sorted alphabetically from Z to A correctlyMedium
24PLP-023Sorting by Price (Low to High)Functional1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Click on sort dropdown
3. Select 'Price (low to high)' option
4. Verify products are sorted by price ascending
5. Compare prices to ensure correct order		Products are sorted by price from lowest to highestMedium
25PLP-024Sorting by Price (High to Low)Functional1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Click on sort dropdown
3. Select 'Price (high to low)' option
4. Verify products are sorted by price descending
5. Compare prices to ensure correct order		Products are sorted by price from highest to lowestMedium
26PLP-025Product Hover EffectsUI1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Hover mouse over product cards
3. Verify hover effects (highlighting, shadow, etc.)
4. Test hover on product images
5. Check hover on Add to Cart buttons		Product cards show appropriate hover effects enhancing user experienceLow
27PLP-026Multiple Product Addition to CartFunctional1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Add first product to cart
3. Verify cart counter shows '1'
4. Add second product to cart
5. Verify cart counter shows '2'
6. Continue adding products and verify counter		Cart counter accurately reflects the number of items addedHigh
28PLP-027Product Image LoadingPerformance1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Monitor product image loading
3. Check for broken images
4. Verify all images load within reasonable time
5. Test on slow network connection		All product images load successfully without broken linksMedium
29PLP-028Page Header and NavigationUI1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Verify header contains:
- Swag Labs logo
- Navigation menu (hamburger icon)
- Shopping cart icon with counter
3. Check header remains fixed while scrolling		Header displays all required elements and remains accessibleMedium
30PLP-029Product Description TruncationUI1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Check product descriptions
3. Verify long descriptions are properly truncated
4. Check if '...' or similar indicators are used
5. Verify consistency across all products		Product descriptions are displayed consistently with proper truncationLow
31PLP-030Add to Cart Button StatesFunctional1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Verify initial state of Add to Cart buttons
3. Click Add to Cart button
4. Verify button state changes (if applicable)
5. Check if button text changes to 'Remove' or similar		Add to Cart buttons show appropriate states and provide clear feedbackMedium
32PLP-031Product Grid ResponsivenessUI1. Access product listing on desktop (1920x1080)
2. Verify number of products per row
3. Resize browser window to tablet size (768px)
4. Check product grid adapts appropriately
5. Test on mobile size (375px)
6. Verify touch interactions work		Product grid adapts properly to different screen sizes maintaining usabilityHigh
33PLP-032Navigation Menu FunctionalityFunctional1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Click on hamburger menu icon
3. Verify menu options display
4. Test each menu option functionality
5. Check menu closes properly		Navigation menu displays correctly and all options function as expectedMedium
34PLP-033Cart Icon NavigationFunctional1. Navigate to product listing page
2. Add at least one product to cart
3. Click on shopping cart icon
4. Verify navigation to cart page
5. Check cart contents are displayed		Cart icon successfully navigates to cart page showing added productsHigh
35PLP-034Page Load Error HandlingEdge Case1. Disable internet connection
2. Try to navigate to product listing page
3. Verify appropriate error message displays
4. Re-enable connection
5. Verify page loads correctly after reconnection		Appropriate error handling when page fails to load with clear user feedbackMedium

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.

tools.name: excel_copy_sheet
tools.description: Copy existing sheet to a new sheet

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

srcSheetName.description: Source sheet name in the Excel file

tools.name: excel_create_table
tools.description: Create a table in the Excel sheet

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

sheetName.description: Sheet name where the table is created

tools.name: excel_describe_sheets
tools.description: List all sheet information of specified Excel file

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

tools.name: excel_read_sheet
tools.description: Read values from Excel sheet with pagination.

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

knownPagingRanges.description: List of already read paging ranges

range.description: Range of cells to read in the Excel sheet (e.g., "A1:C10"). [default: first paging range]

sheetName.description: Sheet name in the Excel file

tools.name: excel_screen_capture
tools.description: [Windows only] Take a screenshot of the Excel sheet with pagination.

fileAbsolutePath.description: Absolute path to the Excel file

knownPagingRanges.description: List of already read paging ranges

allowDangerous.description: Allow dangerous LaunchOptions that reduce security. When false, dangerous args like --no-sandbox will throw errors. Default false.

tools.name: filesystem_read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem_read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem_write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem_edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: filesystem_create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem_list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem_directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem_move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem_search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem_get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem_list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.
